[/quote]

just right click the files and press “open with” and choose notepad or somthing similar.[/quote] Ohhhhhhhhhh so thats why it wasnt working…

item.title: How do i start a 317 source?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

kickingjamie:

1. you need to open them with notepad

They don’t necessarily need to be opened in notepad. They can be opened in Wordpad, eclipse, notepad++ and many others :).

item.title: How do i start a 317 source?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

  1. you need to open them with notepad
  2. search in client.java makeglobalobject
  3. autospawn.cfg file
  4. search on the forums in the board client hacking.
    5.if you do that when you restart the server the npc will be gone.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i start a 317 source?

item.title: How do i start a 317 source?
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

part 2 autospawn npcs

difficulty 1-10

Okay now in your config folder find your autospawn.cfg
you will see somethign similar to this

spawn = 1192	2272	4688	0	0	0	0	0	1

okay now to explain what this means
the

spawn = 1192	2272	4688	0	0	0	0	0	1

[code] xcoord ycoord npcid just leave 0s here until the last one is 1
i think the 0s is the way it faces n stuff but dont mess with that til later make sure u
put a 1 at the end
okay now lets spawn an npc lets spawn a fairy for example

spawn = 1192	2272	57	0	0	0	0	0	1

okay now when you save, compile the fairy will be in those coords have fun spawning
I would also recommend dont spawn a jad anywehre because he really glitches up servers (atleast mine)

part 3 adding\removeing Global objects

difficulty 1-10

okay to start off open your client.java
now search

deletethatobject

you should see something like this

deletethatobject(1212, 1212);

okay now this is pretty simple you just find the x and y coords of the
ceartin object you want to delete now lets delete an edgeville bank booth
put this under the most recent

deletethatobject(3088, 3509);

okay under that add this

[code]deletethatobject(3095, 3491);[code]
make sure it allines with the rest! i use one tab and a few spaces 2 wont work
make sure u always put a ; at the end of statements n stuff like that or whatever it means
okay now that we removed the bank booth we will add something there to replace it
oh btw to find coords stand in the spot and do ::mypos if that dont work idk

okay now to add objects search for

makeGlobalObject

you will see something like this

makeGlobalObject(2921, 4450, 1306, 0, 10); // mage tree

okay now to explain this code

makeGlobalObject(xcoord, ycoord, itemid, face, no idea what the 10 means but put it);

the //magetree is stateing what the id is

now lets spawn a bank booth in the corner of the bank
under the last makeGlobalObject code add this

 makeGlobalObject(3094, 3499, 2213, 0, 10); // bank

the same goes for deleteing 1 tab and a few spaces
save, compile and grats a bank![/code][/code][/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How do i start a 317 source?

item.title: How do i start a 317 source?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

You open a Config/Java file by either double clicking it, or right clicking it then clicking ‘Open’. You can’t edit class files without compiling java files into class files.

You can add objects in your server by using the ‘makeGlobalObject’ method, which you can search for in client.java.

You can create custom weapons by Reading the stickied topics in the MODEL section.

To add NPC’s into your server you can edit the config file named ‘Autospawn.cfg’ and create another line such as:

spawn = 1	0	0	0	0	0	0	0	2	Man

Hope I helped.

Read full topic
